issue.title: Potential Solution for Peacock Ads
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Ads have recently started making their way through Peacock, and seem to have been for many users.

### Proposed solution

The following rules have successfully blocked all ads on Peacock:
```
||g*-vod-us-cmaf-prd-*.cdn.peacocktv.com  # blocks all ads
@@||g*-vod-us-cmaf-prd-mc.cdn.peacocktv.com  # seems to allow the main content to come through.
```

Would love some feedback on if this works for anyone else.

### Additional information

Thanks to [this list of domains](https://gist.github.com/ozankiratli/801ba17705e7f2a904d2e443af5a64f8#peacock) curated by @ozankiratli as the base of this solution.

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>When using the Peacock app on our Roku it is no longer blocking ads. I don't have a screenshot or picture of it. But this behavior is across the board on all of my devices. I also have an Nvidia Shield and the Peacock app on my android phone. They all were blocking ads, and yesterday we noticed they are no longer blocking ads. 
2. I have updated all of my filters and the adguard version. This is currently running on a Raspberry Pi. No changes have been made to my network or devices. So not sure what would have caused the ads all of a sudden.

Peacock ads reappeared for me, and adding the following rule worked for me:

`||g006-vod-us-cmaf-prd-qw.cdn.peacocktv.com^`

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/209105#issuecomment-3059115921
> Please help to enable comments section.

Fixed, but unfortunately MV3 extension cannot update filters due to Google policy, so new rules will be available in one of the next extension updates.
Until then, please add following rule to user rules:
```adblock
||app.termly.io/resource-blocker/
```

comment.body:
Not reproduced on my end.
Try to disable `280blocker`, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

I'm sorry that I'm opening this again, but on the previous issue I opened, the admin closed it without waiting for my response, which is an important subject.

> https://mensi.ch/blog/articles/experimenting-with-a-random-chinese-4k-ip-camera https://github.com/KostasEreksonas/Besder-6024PB-XMA501-ip-camera-security-investigation
> 
> Personally, I'd prefer to block all unknown network activity of Chinese IP cam and it's app. But cannot test, how it will work.

I tested. I blocked all unknown activity of the camera. The URLs I sent here are the ones that do not break any functionality. There were a lot of others that break stuff.

Here are some exames of domains the camera called that are not recommended to block:
*.pub-status.secu100.net
*.int08h.com 
*.ibytedtos.com
*.example.org
*.ipv4only.arpa
*.jfappstore.obs.cn-south-1.myhuaweicloud.com
*.obs-xm-pub.obs.cn-south-1.myhuaweicloud.com
*.myhuaweicloud.com

But the ones I'm sure it's safe to block are:
*.promotion.xmeye.net
*.promotion-en.xmeye.net
*.promotion-quicker.jftechsoft.com
*.tr.acobt.tech

Please, add these 4 domains to block list. They are safe to block and prevents a lot of ads to load. 

### Privacy

- [x] I agree to follow this condition
